alert.note: Alert for Eastern San Juan Mountains Above 10000 Ft; Southern San Luis Valley; Upper Rio Grande Valley, Eastern San Juan Mountains Below 10000 Ft (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 06 at 3:34PM MDT by NWS Pueblo
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southeastern Rio Grande and central Conejos Counties through 415 PM MDT... At 333 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 24 miles southwest of Monte Vista to 12 miles southwest of Capulin to 10 miles southwest of Antonito. Movement was east at 5 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and torrential rainfall. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Heavy rain could cause quick runoff and minor flooding of roads and low water crossings. Locations impacted include... Antonito, Conejos, Ortiz and Platoro. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
